html: Jehovah’s “glory” signifies his presence—literally but also in the “cloud of glory” (Isaiah 4:5-6; 6:1-4; 35:1-2) as in Moses’ tabernacle and Solomon’s temple (Exodus 16:10; 24:15-18; 40:34-38; 1 Kings 8:10-11). Jehovah’s servant—his mouth or mouthpiece (Isaiah 11:4; 49:2; 51:16)—heralds Jehovah’s coming: “Arise, shine, your light has dawned; the glory of Jehovah has risen upon you! Although darkness covers the earth, and a thick mist the peoples, upon you Jehovah will shine; over you his glory shall be visible. Nations will come to your light, their kings to the brightness of your dawn” (Isaiah 60:1-3).
